step.cmd: Perform the following steps to enable the incoming XDR traffic on the ME.

ol.li:
Log in to the active OAME node of the recovering ME site as the tpaadmin user and navigate to the /opt/tpa/bin directory.
$ cd /opt/tpa/bin

Enable the incoming XDR traffic with the following command:
$ sudo ./xdr-traffic-control -a
Output similar to the following will appear: Doing precheck.... Precheck ok, atleast 1 DB Host '192.168.3.104' is active INFO: Starting to Start XDR on '192.168.3.104' INFO:Backup firewall successful. Start incoming XDR traffic successful on this host. Start XDR traffic on '192.168.3.104' successful INFO: Starting to Start XDR on '192.168.3.105' INFO:Backup firewall successful. Start incoming XDR traffic successful on this host. Start XDR traffic on 192.168.3.105' successful INFO: Starting to Start XDR on '192.168.3.102' INFO:Backup firewall successful. Start incoming XDR traffic successful on this host. Start XDR traffic on '192.168.3.102' successful INFO: Starting to Start XDR on '192.168.3.103' INFO:Backup firewall successful. Start incoming XDR traffic successful on this host. Start XDR traffic on '192.168.3.103' successful

As root, log into one of databases of the isolated site and verify the xdr entries were successfully updated to allow XDR traffic using the following command:
#cat/etc/firewalld/direct.xml
The direct.xml file should be successfully updated and should contain entries similar to the following: <rule priority="20" table="filter" ipv="ipv4" chain="ALATPAascustomizationXDR"> -s 10.76.70.142 -j ACCEPT -m comment --comment 'Allow inbound XDR connection'</rule> <rule priority="21" table="filter" ipv="ipv4" chain="ALATPAascustomizationXDR"> -s 10.76.70.143 -j ACCEPT -m comment --comment 'Allow inbound XDR connection'</rule> <rule priority="22" table="filter" ipv="ipv4" chain="ALATPAascustomizationXDR"> -s 10.76.70.144 -j ACCEPT -m comment --comment 'Allow inbound XDR connection'</rule> <rule priority="23" table="filter" ipv="ipv4" chain="ALATPAascustomizationXDR"> -s 10.76.70.144 -j ACCEPT -m comment --comment 'Allow inbound XDR connection'</rule>

step.cmd: Verify that the ME has connected to the OneNDS or Ldap server. This information can be found in the SPSServer.log file and then enable the LDAP Server as follows:

ol.li:
Log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Policy and Charging Configuration→Common→LDAP External Server:
https://<IOHO-FloatingIPAddress>:8443/servicemanager/v18_7/
Choose the Edit LDAP Server button in the line item for the configured LDAP server that appears.
In the LDAP External SPR window change the Admin State from Disabled to Enabled and click on the “Save” button.

step.cmd: Click on the Distribution icon in the line item for the configured LDAP server, you will see the LDAP server undistributed to both the MEs.

ol.li: Select the isolated ME in the “Available Managed Elements” side of the dialog.
Tap the arrow in the direction of the “Managed Elements with Distributed” side of the dialog. The selected ME now appears in the “Managed Elements with Distributed” side of the dialog.
Tap the Update button. The server is now distributed.
Tap on the Distribution icon again, you will see the LDAP server is distributed to the MEs.
